name: 俞齊山
objective: The aims of the course are to make students understanding the backgrounds, developments, as well as the architectures of the most widely used Intel’s microprocessor-based systems. After studying this course, students can also understand the concepts of memory interface, bus interface, interrupt I/O, and DMA I/O.
schedule:
Part I: Introduction to the microprocessors 
Wk1. Introduction to the microprocessor and computer
Wk2. The microprocessor and its architecture
Wk3. Addressing modes

Part II: 8086/8088 Hardware/Interfaces 
Wk4. 8086/8088 Hardware specifications I
Wk5  8086/8088 Hardware specifications II
Wk6. Introductions of Memory interfaces 
Wk7. Designing the ROM and SRAM memory interfaces
Wk8. Analysis the DRAM memory interface
Wk9. Midterm
Wk10.Hierachical memory - cache memory
Wk11.Designing and analysis the cache memory
Wk12.Access the I/O - Interrupt
Wk13. Interrupt II
Wk14. Direct memory access and DMA-controlled I/O
Wk15. Bus interface
Wk16. Serial port and USB port
Wk17. Timing analysis 
Wk18. Final exam
